natural solution: Starting from the furthest inside the parentheses and working outwards, we get $1-(1+(1-(1+(1-x))))=1-(1+(1-(2-x)))$. $1-(1+(1-(2-x)))=(1-(1+(x-1))$. $(1-(1+(x-1))=\boxed{1-x}$.

fixes x :: real
shows  "1 - (1 + (1 - (1 + (1 - x)))) = 1 - x"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $1-(1+(1-(1+(1-x))))$. The final Answer is 1-x
 ### Proof
 Starting from the furthest inside the parentheses and working outwards, we get $1-(1+(1-(1+(1-x))))=1-(1+(1-(2-x)))$. $1-(1+(1-(2-x)))=(1-(1+(x-1))$. $(1-(1+(x-1))=\boxed{1-x}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "1 - (1 + (1 - (1 + (1 - x)))) = 1 - x"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
